intro: Cyphostemma heterotrichum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into elongated, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features include a woody stem, palmate leaves, and a distinct, often branched structure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
